CONVOYS(&) Homeward Bound Convoys. Since the last report 8 convoys, consisting of 95 ships (705,800 tons deadweight) have arrived. There were no casualties of any description. There are now on passage home 27 convoys consisting of 458 ships.(b) Outward bound Convoys. Since the last report 9 convoys consisting of 127 ships (924,300 tons deadweight) have been safely escorted through the danger zone.There were no casualties of any description. There are now in the danger zone 6 convoys, consisting of 117 3hips. 2. FINANCEDuring the week ended the 4th instant, the sum of 1,911,075 was paid in compensation for loss of requisitioned ships, making a total of 5,163,423 paid on this account since the 1st Aprfcl, 1918. 3* REQUISITIONED FOREIGN TONNAGEThe following Norwegian vessels have been requisitioned:"VARILD""BLAAMYRA"DACAP0""SOLLI"The/THE SECRETARY,WAR CABINET. The following casualties by enemy action to requisitioned foreign steamers have been reported :-ex-Norwegian s/s "DUX" ,Prize s/s "POLBRAE"ex-Russian s/s "UMBA"4. STANDARD SHIPSThree standard ships have been delivered, viz;-the s/s "WAR HERMIT", "WAR WAGER" and "WAR KINSMAN". 5. LOSSES AND GAINS OF BRITISH TONNAGE.The losses of British steamers, of 500 gross tons and upwards during the week ended the 4th ultimo were as follows:-Lost by enemy action ... 23 ships of 84,536 gross tons " " marine peril ... 2 " 2,544 " "making a total of......25 ships of 87,080 gross tonsThe gains were as follows:-New Vessels (British built) brought into service14 ships of 54,601 gross tons - making a net loss of 11 " " 32,479 " "In addition there were transferred from Foreign flag8 ships of 21,539 gross tons , This, while representing additional tonnage under the British flag,is not additional tonnage available for service, as in many cases the vessels now transferred have already been engaged in the service of the Allies. 6. EXCHANGE OF BRITISH AND GERMAN PRISONERS OF WARThe Dutch Prisoner of War vessels arrived back at Boston on the 5th instant with 107 English prisoners of war. 271 German prisoners were embarked on the 6th instant. STORES FOR THE BRITISH ARMY IN FRANCE,The quantity of Military Stores discharged in France during the week ending 4th May was 176.457 tons, including 79,347 tons of supplies and 38,191 tons of ammunition.I am,Sir,Your obedient Servant, (Sgd.) John Anderson.
